description: In addition to Intel's Linux engineers being busy preparing hardware enablement support for next-gen Panther Lake client processors, they are also busy beginning to plumb Linux driver support for next-generation Xeon "Diamond Rapids" support as the successor to Xeon 6 Granite Rapids. With Linux 6.12 some new bits are now set to land for Diamond Rapids...
title: More Intel Diamond Rapids Enablement Landing For Linux 6.12

description: Prominent Wayland developer Simon Ser has released Cage v0.2, a Wayland kiosk compositor that runs single, maximized applications...
title: Cage 0.2 Released For Wayland-Powered Kiosks With Single, Maximized Apps

description: Red Hat engineer Karol Herbst continues enhancing Mesa's Rusticl driver that allows for a Rust-based OpenCL driver implementation for use by Gallium3D drivers. The newest addition is a build-time option for controlling devices to be enabled by default...
title: Mesa 24.3 Adds New Build Option To Allow Rusticl Driver Support To Be Enabled By Default

description: Wasmer 4.4 is out as the newest version to this prominent WebAssembly (WASM) runtime that supports WASIX / WASI / EmScripten to "run software anywhere" by effectively serving as lightweight containers and being able to scale from the edge to the cloud...
title: Wasmer 4.4 Released To Continue Pushing Universal Apps With WebAssembly

description: HoneyKrisp as the open-source Mesa Vulkan driver for Apple Silicon graphics and developed as part of the Asahi Linux project has landed a number of enhancements into the mainline Mesa code...
title: Apple Vulkan Driver "HoneyKrisp" Lands Many Fixes & Features

description: OpenRazer 3.9 is out today as the newest version of this community project providing open-source driver support for Razer peripherals on Linux. This out-of-tree set of Linux kernel drivers allows for various Razer devices to be configured and fully leveraged under Linux...
title: OpenRazer 3.9 Adds Support For Many Newer Razer Devices On Linux
